block.p: Police officials said yesterday that investigators were searching for an unidentified rapist who is suspected in separate attacks on two young girls in Queens, most recently last Monday in Astoria.

Investigators said they believed that the man singles out latchkey children, who arrive home from school before their parents return from work. Detectives first suspected a pattern after an 11-year-old girl told them that a man knocked on the door of her family's apartment about 3 p.m. Monday and told her that he was a plumber sent to repair a leak. Once inside the apartment, the police said, the man brandished a knife and raped and sodomized the girl before fleeing. Her parents called the police when they arrived home.

Detectives said they recalled a similar incident that occurred on May 19, 1999. In that case, a 9-year-old girl was raped and sodomized at knifepoint in her Jackson Heights apartment, also by a man who persuaded her to open the door by telling her that he was a plumber.
Each victim described her attacker as a 20- to 30-year-old dark-skinned man who is 5 foot 10 to 6 feet tall and weighs 160 to 180 pounds.
